conclusion: Analyzing the velocity-time graph to find acceleration from 1 to 3 seconds
Graph shows velocity in m/s on vertical axis and time in seconds on horizontal axis
Constant velocity of 2 m/s from 0 to 1 second
Linear decrease in velocity from 2 m/s at t=1s to -2 m/s at t=3s
Constant velocity of -2 m/s after t=3s
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time
Initial velocity at t=1s is 2 m/s
Final velocity at t=3s is -2 m/s
Acceleration a is calculated as -2 m/s²
Slope of v-t graph represents acceleration
Slope calculation confirms acceleration as -2 m/s²
Final answer is acceleration of -2 m/s²
